rules.natural: If John works in an asbestos factory, then he shows respiratory symptoms.
If John works in an asbestos factory, then he does not develop asbestosis.
Either John works in an asbestos factory or he is covered by health insurance.
Provided that John files an insurance claim, then he is denied workers' compensation.
John files an insurance claim or he appeals the insurance denial.
John submits medical records or he provides work history.
Under the condition that John provides work history, then if he appeals the insurance denial, he is denied workers' compensation.
If John is monitored by the health department, then he is covered by health insurance.
The asbestos factory reporting the case to authorities results in the health department investigating the asbestos factory.
Either the asbestos factory reports the case to authorities or a health inspector discovers the asbestos case.
A health inspector discovering the asbestos case serves as sufficient condition for John being monitored by the health department.
The health department issuing a compliance order results in the investigation of the asbestos factory leading to John being monitored by the health department.
An independent auditor confirming safety violations causes the health department finding safety violations to lead to issuing a compliance order.
If the asbestos factory operates under restrictions, then John is covered by health insurance.
The asbestos factory implementing safety protocols leads to it operating under restrictions.
The asbestos factory hiring a safety consultant results in it operating under restrictions.
Factory management deciding on a compliance strategy causes the asbestos factory to follow new regulations.
Either factory management decides on a compliance strategy or it resists changes.
Factory management resisting changes serves as sufficient condition for either implementing safety protocols or hiring a safety consultant.

rules.prover9_expression: recommends(Doctor, TreatmentPlan) -> (diagnosed(John, Asbestosis) -> (receives(John, MedicalTreatment) | covered(John, HealthInsurance)))
rules.natural: If a doctor recommends a treatment plan, then whenever John is diagnosed with asbestosis, he either receives medical treatment or is covered by health insurance.
John having lung scarring results in him developing asbestosis.

rules.prover9_expression: suggests(Specialist, AlternativeTreatment) -> (diagnosed(John, Asbestosis) -> (receives(John, MedicalTreatment) | covered(John, HealthInsurance)))
rules.natural: A specialist suggesting alternative treatment leads to John's diagnosis of asbestosis causing him to either receive medical treatment or be covered by health insurance.
John consulting a medical expert results in him trusting his primary doctor.
John consults a medical expert or he seeks a second opinion.
John seeking a second opinion leads to a specialist suggesting alternative treatment.
John trusting his primary doctor serves as sufficient condition for a doctor recommending a treatment plan.

rules.prover9_expression: demonstrates(AsbestosFactory, Compliance) -> (follows(AsbestosFactory, NewRegulations) -> (implements(AsbestosFactory, SafetyProtocols) | hires(AsbestosFactory, SafetyConsultant)))
rules.natural: The asbestos factory demonstrating compliance leads to its following of new regulations resulting in either implementing safety protocols or hiring a safety consultant.
A regulatory agency verifying compliance leads to the asbestos factory demonstrating compliance.
John showing respiratory symptoms results in him having lung scarring.

rules.prover9_expression: wears(John, ProtectiveGear) | (diagnosed(John, Asbestosis) -> (receives(John, MedicalTreatment) | covered(John, HealthInsurance)))
rules.natural: John wears protective gear or his diagnosis of asbestosis leads to him either receiving medical treatment or being covered by health insurance.
If John is denied workers' compensation, then he is not eligible for workers' compensation.

rules.prover9_expression: -(submits(John, MedicalRecords) -> (appeals(John, InsuranceDenial) -> denied(John, WorkersCompensation))) -> wins(John, LegalCase)
rules.natural: Should it not be true that John submitting medical records leads to his appeal resulting in denial, then he wins the legal case.
If John submitting medical records does not lead to his appeal resulting in denial, then he does not win the legal case.

rules.prover9_expression: -(follows(AsbestosFactory, NewRegulations) -> (implements(AsbestosFactory, SafetyProtocols) | hires(AsbestosFactory, SafetyConsultant))) -> faces(AsbestosFactory, Shutdown)
rules.natural: Provided that the asbestos factory following new regulations does not lead to implementing safety protocols or hiring a safety consultant, then it faces shutdown.
If the asbestos factory following new regulations does not result in implementing safety protocols or hiring a safety consultant, then it does not face shutdown.
If John is not covered by health insurance, then he is eligible for workers' compensation.

facts.natural: The health department finds safety violations.
An independent auditor confirms safety violations.
John does not receive medical treatment.
John does not wear protective gear.

target.natural: John is covered by health insurance.
